      • createNewTempTableBasedOnThis

        IBeforeUpgradeTable createNewTempTableBasedOnThis()
        Creates a new table based on this table's entity metadata. The table must be associated with an entity. Columns that did not exist in this table are not created on the temp table, even if the metadata defines such a column. Note that this table may not contain columns that are going to be renamed because the metadata will reflect the new name for the column but will not have an entry for the old name, so it will not be added to the temp table. Consider createNewTempTableBasedOnCurrentSchema() if you are creating a temp table which will be used to copy all the data from an existing table.
        Returns:
        a new object representing the temp table
        See Also:
        createNewTempTableBasedOnCurrentSchema()

      • createNewTempTableBasedOnCurrentSchema

        IBeforeUpgradeTable createNewTempTableBasedOnCurrentSchema()
        Creates a new table based on this table's schema in the database. This table must be associated with an entity and must also exist in the database. Note that the returned temp table will contain the columns that this table has in the database right now, and the columns may not match those specified in the entity metadata. For example the metadata might contain a new column that is not yet created (because of an add or rename), or might not contain a column that is yet to be deleted/renamed.

        This method is usually more appropriate than createNewTempTableBasedOnThis() if you are about to copy data from this table into the new temp table as you know the columns will match exactly.

        Returns:
        a new object representing the temp table
        See Also:
        createNewTempTableBasedOnThis()

      • createAsNewTempTable

        IBeforeUpgradeTable createAsNewTempTable(Pair<java.lang.String,IDataType>... columns)
        Creates a new temp table with this table's name and the given columns. The table must not already exist and must not be associated with an entity. Note that the user must explicitly drop the temp table .
        Parameters:
        columns - a set of column name, data type pairs specifying the columns to be created
        Returns:
        this

        Returns:

      • dropAllIndexes

        IBeforeUpgradeTable dropAllIndexes()
        Drops all indexes on this table
        Returns:
        this

      • createAllIndexes

        IBeforeUpgradeTable createAllIndexes()
        Creates all indexes on this table. To be more precise, this method will also drop unnecessary indexes. Due to the renaming of indexes (the prefix stays the same, but the suffix changes), the situation may arise where we may not be able to create an index because of a name conflict. To be consistent, we drop all unnecessary indexes when we create new ones. In other words, the net result of calling this method is that the table will be in the expected state with regards to indexes.
        Returns:
        this

      • createIndex

        IBeforeUpgradeTable createIndex(boolean unique,
                                java.lang.String... columnNames)
        Create a non-clustered, non-spatial index on the given columns. All keys are sorted in ascending order. The intent is that this index would be temporary
        Parameters:
        columnNames - names of columns that make this index, in order
        Returns:
        this

      • updateStatistics

        IBeforeUpgradeTable updateStatistics()
        Updates statistics on the table. Note that statistics will again be updated as part of the automated portion of the upgrade.
        Returns:
        this

      • dropColumns

        IBeforeUpgradeTable dropColumns(IBeforeUpgradeColumn... columns)
        More efficient operation that allows dropping multiple columns in one operation. Some databases don't support this, so multiple operations will be performed.
        Returns:
        this

      • alterMultipleColumnsToMatchDatamodel

        IBeforeUpgradeTable alterMultipleColumnsToMatchDatamodel(IBeforeUpgradeColumn... columnNames)
        More efficient operation that allows altering the type (but not nullability) of multiple columns in one operation. Some databases don't support this, so multiple operations will be performed.
        Returns:
        this

      • createTempColumn

        IBeforeUpgradeColumn createTempColumn(java.lang.String columnName,
                                      IDataType columnDataType)
        Creates a new nullable column with the given name and datatype to hold temporary data. Note that the user must explicitly drop the temp column. The schema verifier will catch if the user did not drop it.
        Returns:
        an object representing the new column
